children: A 58-year-old woman is evaluated prior to an elective total hip arthroplasty.
Which of the following abnormalities is seen on this patient's ECG?

This ECG shows evidence of a nonacute inferior myocardial infarction, with Q waves in leads II, III, and aVF and without ST-segment changes. Additionally, it demonstrates a nonacute posterior myocardial infarction (or posterior extension of the inferior infarction) with increased R-wave amplitude and duration (R>S), without ST-segment changes in the anterior precordial leads V
There are no ECG changes consistent with an anterior or lateral infarction.

objective.__html: Identify a nonacute inferior myocardial infarction on ECG.
